Dear ___,

I hope this letter finds you in good health and spirits. I am writing to provide you with a summary of your recent hospital stay with us from March 10, 2024, to March 12, 2024.

You were admitted to our hospital on March 10, 2024, due to chest pain (CP) and shortness of breath (SoB) with ST elevation detected in leads v5-6 on an ECG. These symptoms were concerning for an ST elevation myocardial infarction (STEMI) involving the left main coronary artery. During your stay, our team conducted a thorough evaluation which confirmed this diagnosis.

On March 11, 2024, you underwent an ECG that continued to show ST elevation. The hospital guidelines recommend percutaneous coronary intervention (PCA); however, due to circumstances beyond our control, including difficulty contacting the cardiac catheterization lab and the cardiology team, we proceeded with medical management.

Your laboratory results showed elevated levels of Troponin T, which were 30 and 29 on consecutive tests, corroborating the diagnosis of myocardial injury. In response, you were administered a regimen known as MONAC, which includes morphine for pain management, oxygen to maintain adequate blood saturation, nitroglycerin to relieve chest pain, and aspirin as an anti-platelet measure.

Morphine was given at 2-4 mg as needed for pain, oxygen therapy at 2-4 L/min if oxygen saturation fell below 90%, nitroglycerin at 0.4 mg every 5 minutes up to three doses if pain persisted, and aspirin in a single chewed dose of 324 mg.

On March 12, 2024, during a ward round, you expressed that your chest pain had resolved and requested discharge. Having ensured that you met the criteria for safe discharge from our medical standpoint, we proceed with your request. 

Please continue to monitor your symptoms and follow the prescribed medication plan as discussed with Dr. ___. It is important to keep follow-up appointments with your primary care physician and cardiologist to ensure your continued recovery and to manage any underlying conditions effectively.

If you have any questions or further concerns, do not hesitate to get in touch with us at the hospital. Thank you for allowing us to be part of your healthcare team. 

Wishing you a swift recovery and the best of health.

Sincerely,

Dr. ___
